section.title: RSS
section.p: RSS is a Web content syndication format. Its name is an acronym for Really Simple Syndication. RSS has been the standard format to syndicate content between sites for years. Syndication allows you to share content between sites by offering it in a XML format. Consumers can check the RSS feed of a site to easily determine if it has changed. This opens the door to many interesting scenarios, and syndication is thus one of the more interesting features of content management systems.

section.title: RSS within Lenya
section.p: The publication "Lenya News and Comments" (pubs/forum) is providing/producing RSS, which is consumed by the publication OSCOM (pubs/oscom) and the publication lenya.org (pubs/lenya.org).
